did.unittitle: Records of the Office of External Affairs, Commencement and Special Events

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Office of University Events

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Office of External Affairs. Commencement and Special Events

physdesc.extent: in 5 record cartons, 57 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box, 1 flat box, 5 oversize flat boxes, 1 custom box, 1 flat-file folder, 7 folders in shared manuscript boxes, and 37 boxes without container profiles.

did.abstract: The New York University Commencement and Special Events division was part of the Office of External Affairs which operated under the leadership of the Vice President for External Affairs. In 2002, the Office of External Affairs was replaced by the Office of University Relations and Public Affairs, while the Office of University Events took over the role of event planning. This collection contains files created by these offices for University-wide and individual New York University school events dating from 1834 to 2019. Event planning files contain correspondence, notes, audio recordings, ephemera, and published material created for these events. This collection also contains a large assemblage of All-University Commencement programs, tickets, invitations, speeches, rosters, and plannings notes dating from 1834 to 2019. Baccalaureate service programs and other Commencement-related events ephemera are also in this collection. Files created for various Commencement financial prizes and awards document their creation and administration, dating from 1941 to 2000.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Administrative records and unpublished reports of New York University are closed for a period of 20 years from the date of their creation. Access to files spanning multiple years will be opened to researchers based on the date of the most recent materials. Board of Trustees records are closed for 35 years from the date of creation. Materials related to personnel, grievances, job and fellowship searches and applications, and all files that fall under the federal Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) are permanently restricted. Additional restrictions may apply to other materials in this collection. For questions regarding specific restrictions, please contact the University Archives.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were first accessioned from the Office of External Affairs by the University Archives in 1997. Additional boxes were accessioned from the Office of University Events in 2011. Accretions were transferred to the Archives in 2016, 2018, 2019, and 2022.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Eight school banners, eleven audiocassettes, and two cartons of books previously owned by former University President John Brademas were removed and returned to the University Archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: Series I. Events; Series II: Publications; Series III. Commencement; and Series IV. Commencement Prizes and Awards.
Series I and III are arranged chronologically, and in Series II the same events are grouped together and arranged chronologically within those groups. Series IV is arranged alphabetically.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Commencement and Special Events division was part of the Office of External Affairs and operated under the direction of the Vice President for External Affairs. The Commencement and Special Events department was responsible for the planning, organization, and overseeing of university events and commencement ceremonies. Other than convocation ceremonies, the department regularly organized university events such as anniversary celebrations, guest lectures, fundraising dinners, and site dedications. In 2002, the Office of External Affairs was replaced by the Office of University Relations and Public Affairs. The Office of University Events operates within this division and coordinates the many events formerly handled by the Commencement and Special Events department of the Office of External Affairs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Records of the Office of External Affairs, Commencement, and Special Events; RG 7.4; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding the arrangement, description, and physical interventions taken on this collection prior to 2017 have not yet been recorded. In 2017, an accrual was incorporated into the collection in accordance with the existing arrangement scheme in Box 42. In 2018 an accrual was incorporated into the collection's existing Series I. and III. In 2019, materials were rehoused by Preservation and sent to offsite storage. Further accruals were received in 2021 and 2022, and incorporated into Series III.

In 2023, titles from the existing inventory were edited, adding dates, combining duplicate title listings of the same event, and moving the titles into chronological order as was originally stated in the arrangement note. Unprocessed material had been foldered, but when necessary, overstuffed folders were divided into smaller groupings. Most of the manuscript boxes were found to be discolored and damaged. These were replaced with new boxes. All but two copies of print material were retained and the remaining were removed from the collection. The audio cassettes were numbered and labeled and listed appropriately within the inventory.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p:
Records of Arthur L. Brandon, 1957-1962
Records of the Office of Radio and Television, 1953-1985
Records of the Office of the Senior Vice President, William F. Payne, for External Affairs, 1968-1980

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains planning files, publications, and ephemera generated by the Commencement and Special Events division of the Office of External Affairs, and the Office of University Events. Event planning files date from 1870 to 2019, documenting preparation for New York University events which includes lectures, faculty convocations, honorary degrees, NYU Presidential Inaugurations, and NYU's Sesquicentennial celebration (1980) activities. Published material in this collection includes programs and ephemera from 1956 to 1995 related to NYU events such as dedications, convocations, lectures, and building openings. These materials complement event files in Series I. Commencement files document the experience of attendees through ephemera, graduation rosters, speeches, audio recordings, event scripts, and planning notes for the Commencement ceremony itself and related events dating from 1834 to 2019. Files accumulated on prizes and awards in this collection typically contain correspondence and supporting documentation on financial awards distributed to individuals during Commencement week. These files date from 1941 to 2000.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Oversized materials from the NYU Celebrates 2000 event were incorporated into general University Archives collections created for specific formats.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by NYU are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the University Archives. Please contact University Archives, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact the University Archives, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

controlaccess.corpname: New York University -- Alumni and alumnae

physdesc.extent: in 1 record carton, 11 manuscript boxes, one half manuscript box, 1 flat-file folder, 1 card box, 2 flat boxes, 1 oversize flat box, and 28 boxes without container profiles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains planning files and print material dating from 1870 to 2019 for New York University recurring and individual events including NYU Presidential inaugurations, student orientations, Alumni activities, building groundbreaking ceremonies, NYU Sesquicentennial celebrations, faculty and freshman convocations, presentations, lectures, and Parent's Day/Weekend events. Planning files typically contain correspondence, notes, mock-ups for print items, published material, and ephemera. Series II contains ephemera for many of the events listed in this series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in chronological order.

physdesc.extent: in 1 record carton, 3 flat boxes, 2 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize flat box, and 9 boxes without container profiles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains printed items created for New York University events. Files in this series include programs, schedules, booklets, and promotional and marketing material dating from 1956 to 1995. Events include awards ceremonies, convocations, NYU anniversaries, and receptions for special guests and dignitaries. This series includes a large collection of Founders' Day event programs as well as audio recordings dating from 1956 to 1993. Planning files for many of the events in this series can be found in Series I.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in groupings and chronologically within.

physdesc.extent: in 4 record cartons, 46 manuscript boxes, 2 flat boxes, 1 oversize flat box, and 52 boxes without container profiles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes paper files and audio recordings for New York University's Commencement, Baccalaureate, and related events dating from 1834 to 2019. Files typically contain programs, invitations, tickets, rosters, event schedules, and speaker lists. Event scripts, librettos, and instructions in this series provided guidance for those who presented and participated in the various ceremonies. Alternate plans for inclement weather and other scenarios are also in this series. This series also contains handwritten addresses from NYU's early Commencement ceremonies, and printed copies of many of addresses given by NYU Presidents, Deans, and guests over the years. Special Commencement edition issues of the NYU Bulletin included copies of Commencement and Baccalaureate addresses, schedules, and rosters of graduating students. Planning correspondence, post-event analysis notes, and dressing instructions for student and faculty are also in this series. A small collection of audio recordings and collectible items related to Grad Alley are also in this series. Commencement ephemera for some of NYU's schools and divisions is also in this series including the Law School, Medical School, and Steinhardt School. General planning files from the 1970s and 1980s refer to specific tasks, including commencement stage and canopy design, and designs for new banners and logos for graduation robes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in chronological order.

Series IV. Commencement Prizes and Awards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes files related to the creation, administration, and distribution of commencement prizes and awards given to staff and graduating students dating from 1941 to 2000. Files in this series typically contain correspondence, check request forms, and notes. Prizes and award titles include the Albert S. Borgman Memorial Prize Fund, Distler-Blankfort Award in Forensics, Distinguished Administrator Award, Distinguished Teaching Medal, and Wortis Biological Prize Fund.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series begins with general correspondence, followed by alphabetically arranged files.
